definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Where a crime is committed as mentioned in any Article of this Decision, all his earnings and property illegally obtained shall be confiscated;
sentences.chinese: 犯本決定各條罪的，其違法所得的一切財物予以沒收。

sentences.english: Can say, confiscate what bring about pair of citizen money property right directly is privative with limitation.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，沒收直接導致對公民財產權的剝奪和限制。

sentences.english: I hadn’t been paid for the job yet, obviously, and didn’t have any money.
sentences.chinese: 顯然我還沒收到工錢，而且我自己也沒錢了。

sentences.english: Jannet : Oh well, better late than never.
sentences.chinese: 是嗎，遲到總比沒收到強。
校長沒收了湯米的射豆槍。

sentences.english: Tow guy: The government is impounding it.
sentences.chinese: 政府沒收了，這是你的收據。

sentences.english: No one can sequestrate his estates.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都不能沒收他的資產。

sentences.english: Of course, the search that confiscates building guaranty about the bank also is in grow considerably.
sentences.chinese: 當然，關於銀行沒收房屋抵押的搜索也在大幅增長。

sentences.english: Not having received any reply from Tom, Mary decided to write to him again.
sentences.chinese: 由於沒收到湯姆的迴音，瑪麗決定再給他寫封信。

sentences.english: The smuggled articles must be confiscated.
sentences.chinese: 走私物品一定被沒收了。

sentences.english: An ordinary video camera can be confiscated and its tape destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 一架普通的攝相機可能被沒收或磁帶被銷燬。

sentences.english: The vanishment of Forfeiture of Property is an inexorable historical tr…
sentences.chinese: 沒收財產刑走向消亡是歷史的必然趨勢。

sentences.english: Would you have made me quit smokin’ by finding one of my lighters?
sentences.chinese: 你能否沒收我的打火機，讓我把煙戒掉？

sentences.english: The marijuana he carried was confiscated and destroyed, according to police. (Chris Hondros/Getty Images)
sentences.chinese: 根據警方的消息，他攜帶的大麻被已沒收和銷燬。

sentences.english: Third, the range of confiscating the illegal income and the interest produced form it.
sentences.chinese: 三是沒收違法所得及產生的收益的範圍問題。

definition: to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to send/to give as a present
to be overdue/to exceed the time limit/to expire (as in expiration date)
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
